metadata.title: CVE-2021-32557 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
It was discovered that the process_report() function indata/whoopsie-upload-all allowed arbitrary file writes via symlinks.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-32557` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

apport - 2.20.11-0ubuntu67
apport-gtk - 2.20.11-0ubuntu67
apport-kde - 2.20.11-0ubuntu67
apport-noui - 2.20.11-0ubuntu67
apport-retrace - 2.20.11-0ubuntu67
apport-valgrind - 2.20.11-0ubuntu67
dh-apport - 2.20.11-0ubuntu67
python3-apport - 2.20.11-0ubuntu67
python3-problem-report - 2.20.11-0ubuntu67
No subscription required

criterions.comment: apport package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.20.11-0ubuntu67').
